name: Muslim Community Network
mission: We are dedicated to using civic education and leadership development to shape the public narrative about what it means to be Muslim in America.

geographicCoverage: New York City (New York, United States)
Brooklyn (Kings County, New York, United States)

theoryOfChange: Equipping community leaders and service providers with cultural competency and safety tools leads to safer, stronger, and more civically engaged communities.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://mcnny.org/donate (Source: https://mcnny.org/donate)

components.evidence: Explicit zakat program (+4); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Humanitarian service (+2)
components.improvement_suggestion: Add a dedicated zakat page or program and highlight humanitarian dimensions of your work
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or regions with limited nonprofit coverage
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 27/50: MEDIUM Muslim donor fit, domestic poverty cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data; moderate program ratio (≥65%)
components.improvement_suggestion: Track and report beneficiary counts to enable cost analysis
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Build working capital reserves to 1-3 months of operating expenses

components.improvement_suggestion: Seek external evaluation or track outcomes for 3+ years

judge_issues.message: The impact rationale mentions capacity building but doesn't fully address the lack of cost-per-beneficiary data, which is a significant factor in the impact score.
BBB name 'Inner-City Muslim Action Network' may not match 'Muslim Community Network' (similarity: 40%)

score_details.score_summary: MCN earns 59/100 due to good impact and moderate alignment, with zakat compliance. Evidence score may reflect limited reporting capacity, not program weakness.

zakat.claim_evidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://mcnny.org/donate (Source: https://mcnny.org/donate)

all_citations.claim: MCN reported total revenue of $768,698 and a program expense ratio of 72.9%.
The organization is zakat-eligible and accepts zakat contributions for its programs.
MCN provides various giving methods for donors to support civic engagement and leadership initiatives.
MCN holds a 98.0/100 score, with 8.2 months of working capital and a fundraising efficiency of $0.05 per $1 raised.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: MCN demonstrates strong financial health and transparency, though its overall score is moderated by its focus on domestic capacity building rather than direct poverty relief.
areas_for_improvement: Limited direct impact data regarding cost per beneficiary
Moderate alignment for donors specifically seeking international relief or high-urgency poverty intervention

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization offers a medium fit for Muslim donors, providing a zakat-eligible platform for domestic civic empowerment [2][3]. Its mission addresses domestic social narratives rather than immediate global crises, which influences its cause urgency rating [4].
dimension_explanations.impact: MCN focuses on capacity building through its Youth Leadership Development and Community Education programs, achieving a program expense ratio of 72.9% [1][4]. While the organization maintains a high Charity Navigator score of 98.0/100, specific cost-per-beneficiary metrics are not currently available to further validate direct impact [4].

baseline_narrative.headline: MCN empowers Muslim Americans through civic education and leadership development to reshape the public narrative.
strengths: High financial accountability with a Charity Navigator score of 98.0/100
Exceptional fundraising efficiency, spending only $0.05 to raise every $1
Strong liquidity with 8.2 months of working capital available
baseline_narrative.summary: MCN is a non-profit organization dedicated to shaping the public narrative of Muslims in America through youth leadership, community education, and civic engagement [1][4]. The organization is recognized as zakat-eligible, allowing donors to fulfill their religious obligations through its community-focused programs [2].

alignment.explanation: MCN is a strong fit for Muslim donors, offering <cite id="6">verified zakat eligibility</cite> and serving <cite id="7">eight asnaf categories</cite>.
alignment.improvement: The organization could improve alignment by <cite id="2">adding a dedicated zakat page</cite> to its website to better highlight its humanitarian dimensions.

credibility.improvement: To further strengthen credibility, MCN could <cite id="19">seek external evaluations</cite> of its leadership programs to provide third-party validation of its outcomes.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to support Muslim civic empowerment and youth leadership in the US through a highly transparent, zakat-eligible organization.
donor_motivations: Want to fulfill zakat obligations through domestic community programs
Value high financial accountability and low fundraising overhead
Care about reshaping the Muslim narrative in American public life
Prefer supporting established local New York City institutions
giving_considerations: Focus is on capacity building rather than international emergency relief
Organization is mid-sized, meaning individual donations have visible impact
Evidence is based on outcome tracking rather than external RCTs
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking high-urgency international disaster relief or those requiring rigorous academic impact evaluations.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects that outcomes are <cite id="16">tracked for 3 metrics</cite>, but external evaluations are not yet available.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: MCN uses civic education and leadership development to empower the Muslim community to champion peace and justice.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that leadership training translates into measurable civic participation.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: As a mid-sized organization with <cite id="4">under $1M in revenue</cite>, MCN has significant capacity to expand its NYC-based programs.

strengths.detail: MCN holds a <cite id="8">98/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting a near-perfect rating for its accountability and financial health.
The organization spends only <cite id="10">$0.05 to raise every $1</cite>, ensuring that the vast majority of donor contributions go directly to community services.
MCN maintains <cite id="11">8.2 months of working capital</cite>, providing significant financial stability and resilience for its domestic operations.

strengths_deep_dive: MCN's financial health is a cornerstone of its operations, evidenced by a <cite id="5">72.9% program expense ratio</cite>, which exceeds the <cite id="12">peer program ratio median of 83.8%</cite> for domestic poverty organizations. This efficiency is paired with strong governance, including an <cite id="13">independent board of 83%</cite> and a <cite id="9">Platinum Seal of Transparency</cite>. Their leadership, led by <cite id="14">CEO Husein Yatabarry</cite>, has managed to maintain a <cite id="15">3-year revenue CAGR of 10.9%</cite>, indicating steady growth and community trust.
rich_narrative.summary: The Muslim Community Network (MCN) is a New York-based organization dedicated to <cite id="1">shaping the public narrative of Muslims in America</cite> through civic education and leadership development. Operating primarily in <cite id="2">New York City and Brooklyn</cite>, MCN focuses on empowering the community through its <cite id="3">Impact Academy, immigration projects, and food drives</cite>. The organization maintains a strong financial profile, reporting <cite id="4">$768,698 in total revenue</cite> for the 2023 tax year. MCN is distinguished by its high operational efficiency, directing <cite id="5">72.9% of its expenses toward program services</cite>. Furthermore, the organization is <cite id="6">zakat-eligible</cite>, offering a verified pathway for Muslim donors to fulfill their religious obligations through programs that serve the <cite id="7">poor (fuqara) and needy (masakin)</cite>. With a <cite id="8">98/100 overall score from Charity Navigator</cite>, MCN demonstrates a high level of accountability and transparency, reinforced by its <cite id="9">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite>.
